article.title: Cancellation of divergences in unitary gauge calculation of $H →γγ$ process via one W loop, and application

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main advantage of using the unitary gauge in electroweak theory calculations, as highlighted in the article?
choices: It simplifies calculations by reducing the number of Feynman diagrams.
It eliminates the need to consider gauge invariance.
It facilitates the use of dimensional regularization.

multiple_choice_question.text: What key issue does the article address regarding the calculation of the H → γγ decay width in the unitary gauge?
choices: The appearance of non-physical Goldstone boson contributions.
The presence of ultraviolet divergences and the need for their consistent cancellation.
The breaking of Lorentz invariance in the intermediate steps of the calculation.
The ambiguity in defining the Higgs boson mass in this gauge.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the article, what is the significance of the boundary condition at infinity in momentum space for the Feynman propagator?
choices: It ensures the cancellation of all divergences in the calculation.
It allows for the unambiguous definition of the Dyson scheme.
It determines the physical renormalization conditions.
It is necessary for maintaining gauge invariance in the final result.
